title: Strictly's Oti Mabuse reveals she had a backstage 'rant' during Halloween show
text:
She was among the top performing dancers with celebrity partner Kelvin Fletcher on Strictly's Halloween special.

But Oti Mabuse revealed she had a sour moment backstage during the live show on Saturday, which was hilariously captured in a surprise photo.

The South African dancer, 29, shared a snap of her 'annoyed face' while standing next to this week's leaderboard topper Michelle Visage.

Backstage rant: Oti Mabuse revealed she had a sour moment backstage during the Strictly live show on Saturday, which was hilariously captured in a surprise photo

In the snap Oti appears fuming while Michelle, 51, dressed as Morticia Addams, strikes a sultry pose.

Oti captioned the snap: 'When you're going OFF on a rant and your friend doesn't warn you about the cameras lurking @michellevisage look at you posing.'

She also drew an arrow next to herself and wrote 'annoyed face' with a second arrow pointing at Michelle reading 'Gorgeous face.'

It is unclear what made Oti furious but she showed she was taking it in good spirits with a crying with laughter emoji.

Sinister: Oti captioned the snap: 'When you're going OFF on a rant and your friend doesn't warn you about the cameras lurking' (above, doing the Tango with Kelvin)

Kelvin and Oti turned out another stellar performance in Halloween Week where they scored 36 out of 40 for their tango.

Despite one small mistake, the pair were showered with praise for their dance, with Bruno gushing: 'Bad! Bad! Oh but so good, talk about a Tango with a killer bite, almost hypnotic power and intention.

'The staccato was razor sharp, the dance the choreography my darling was superb. You made a mistake in the link there, otherwise it was one of the most memorising tangos I've ever seen. The Prince of Darkness is the Prince of Tango.'

Without the error it seemed likely that Kelvin and Oti would have scored higher, but regardless they still earned 36 points out of 40.

The pair will be dancing the Viennese waltz to Say Something by A Great Big World and Christina Aguilera in this week's show.
description: Oti Mabuse revealed she had a sour moment backstage during the live show on Saturday, which was hilariously captured in a surprise photo.
